_header: Rome no thing is peer to thee
Bibliographic Ghosts: Manchester, Chetham’s Library 11379 [Mun. A.6.90]: this copy of Trevisa is missing chapters 20-30 between folios 45 and 46; Glasgow, Glasgow University Library Hunterian 83 (T.3.21): this is Brut Chronicle, not Trevisa; New York, Pierpont Morgan Library M875 [olim Helmingham Hall]: Only Trevisa’s De Proprietatibus here, not Polychronicon.
_description: In praise of Rome — one quatrain in Trevisa’s translation of Higden’s Polychronicon (Book 1, chap. 24) — in quatrains

CamStJohn204.Transcription:
Rome no þing is pere to þeþeyȝ þu nygh all
                    fallynge beauaille þu schewest þy boundehow grete þu
                    were when þow were sounde
CamStJohn204.Editions:
Babington,  Churchill,  and  Joseph Rawson Lumby, eds.  
             Polychronicon Ranulphi Higden Monachi Cestrensis.
             9 vols. 
             Rolls Series
         41 (1865-66; repr. Kraus, 1964): 1.213.
Mätzner,  Edouard Adolf Ferdinand. 
             Altenglische Sprachproben, I: Poesie.
         Berlin: Wiedmann, 1867: 2.359.

BLAdd24194.Transcription:
Rome no þing is pere to þeþeiȝ þu nyȝ
                    al fallynge beaualle þu schewest þy boundehow grete þu
                    were whan þu were sounde

BLCottTibDVII.Transcription:
Rome noþing peer ys to þeþey þow nyȝ all
                    fallyng bea falle ȝow schewest ȝy bondHow greet ȝu were
                    whan ȝu were sond

BLHar1900.Transcription:
Rome no þinge is pere to þeeþouȝ þou
                    neiȝ fallinge beA walle þu schewest þi bondeHow grete
                    þu were whan þu were sound

BLSto65.Transcription:
Rome nothynge is pere to theThough thou neygh all faylynge beOn
                    all þou sheuest thy boundeHowe grete thou were whan thou were
                    sounde
BLSto65.Note:
Written as prose. Folio number reflects the most recent
                    foliation.

AbeUL21.First Lines:
Rome no þing is þere to þeþeiȝ þou
                    nyȝ of fallyng de…
AbeUL21.Last Lines: …how grete þou were whanne þou were sounde

HunHM28561.Transcription:
Rome noþing is pere to þeeþouȝ þou neiȝ
                    al falling beAualle þou shewist þy bondehow grete þou
                    were whan þou were sounde
